bibl.title: Letter from Virginia Stiles to [Laura Armistead Carter], September 18, 1925

div1.p: Stiles sends [Laura Carter] her sympathy upon the death of Henry Carter.

div1.head: Letter from Virginia Stiles to [Laura Armistead Carter], September 18, 1925

opener.dateline:
311 Ocean Ave
Bradley Beach
N. J.

div1.p:
How shocked we
were to hear the
ultimate result of
that long illness even
tho we knew the
end was near, and
how sorry Wardell
and I are not to
have been in Washington
at the time of your
dear father's death.
We did not receive
the Post promptly,
as is usually the
case after the season
is over down here,-
hence could not
wire you at the time.

My heart aches
for you as I too
have experienced
the loss of a devoted
father. I shall not
say more than that
his your father's going has robbed us of a
friend and the world of a
great benefactor.

How I do want to see you and
help you- I wonder where you
are just now and where
you will be in the future.
Do not forget us and let me
hear from you some day soon.
